intro: Roulinia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan roulinia, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
